content.description:
From the D'Antonio 2010 edition Shelf guidebook...

"Climb the short wall on the left side of the steep buttress."
content.location:
It is in the alcove, just left of

Chump Change

.

content.description:
This line climbs the dihedral just a few feet right of

Nickel & Dime

and finishes at the same anchor. Some of the rock in the dihedral is a little junky. There are some fun finger locks along the way.

Feel free to update with FA and route name if anyone knows. I added the route, because many of the other route locations here are based on the number of routes from right to left and this, the furthest right, is not accounted for.
content.protection: A handful of draws to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: It is the first line when approaching via the trail.

content.description:
The rock is standard Shelf Road fare, pretty solid and topping out on the sharp black water drop features.

The climbing is maybe 5.11 up to the second horizontal break, where a good rest can be had.  Then pull off a couple difficult moves followed by some thin climbing that's not as hard to the anchors.  It is however possible to fall off after the crux if you're not thinking with your feet.

For folks with a large wingspan (maybe 6'4"), there is a tricky to get pinch out right that was vital for me.  For shorter folks, you've got some bad, shallow pockets you'll have to pinch? just left of the bolt line.

This is a good place to be when Cactus is crowded with people and dogs.  There's also a few routes on the front of the buttress to warm up on.
content.protection: A long quickdraw is nice at the crux if you are working the route.  This will make the clip a bit easier.

content.description:
Climb

Cash In The Vault

past the first bolt, then veer right and up across the clean, blond face to gain the base of the blunt, gray prow at the left. Technical moves up the prow lead to anchors on the left.
content.location:
Next to

Cash in the vault

on the Cash Wall.

content.description:
Start a bit left of the prominent, left-facing corner, reach high and climb the chunky face to the first roof. Pull directly past the bolt, 10d/11a. Continue up some thinness, maybe 11a, to the upper roof and anchors shared with

Funny Money

.
content.location: This route is located on the Cash Wall, which is the small wall just to the left (west) of Cactus Cliff. It is the first route (on the east) that you come to from the road.

climbs.name: Money for Nothing
climbs.fa: Derek Lawrence, Jonathan Lagoe, Kate Siwicke

content.description:
Scramble up to the right side of the ledge shared with the start of

Money Changers

. Grab the double pockets, and start cranking. Head up to the crack/seam and continue to the anchors.... This is pumpier than it looks!
content.protection: 4 bolts plus 2 bolt anchor and doubled quicklinks at the anchor.
content.location:
It is between

Money Changers

and

Guns in the Vault

.

content.description: This is a left-trending route with a rest before a black bulge crux. It is a boulder problem. It was established by Nathan Hollingsworth on 2/28/2010.
content.location: Hike to the Cash Wall. It is located on the south side of the formation. Look for the writing on the wall.

content.description:
This route climbs a beautiful, albeit quite short, panel of flawless vertical limestone.  Despite its length, the route is quite continuous and offers more great moves than many routes twice as long.

Begin on the left edge of the panel, making awkward moves up, then right to gain the center of the wall.  Weave up the wall with long reaches and high steps between crisp, hidden edges.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor. The first bolt has an angle iron hanger.
content.location:
Climb the short, black panel down and right of the "

Cash in the Vault

" panel. It is immediately left of "

Guns in the Vault

".

content.description: Scramble up onto a small stance and climb up the right side of the obvious flake to an awkward and unprotected, but not difficult mantle.  Weave your way up the face, pull a tiny roof and ramble up to a steep crack, start up on jugs, and enjoy clipping the bolt in mid-crux, with ledge fall potential (instead of clipping it from jugs with great feet).  Head up right to the anchors.
content.protection: 9 bolts, some in kind of awkward locations.
content.location: This route is located on the Cash Wall, which is the small wall just to the left (west) of Cactus Cliff.  The route is the second route from the right and can be identified by the large, thick flake at the first 2 bolts.

content.description: An interesting technical sequence in a dihedral that is more interesting than it appears from the ground. Depending on how you feel about stemming this might feel like low 5.10 ground.
content.location: As of today this was the 3rd route on the wall if you are approaching from the Cactus Cliff area walking west. From Cactus, the path starts on the left (West) from the switchback in the road just past what used to be the main Cactus Cliff parking lot.

content.description: This is short. It begins with deep pockets, wanders to the left to a flake sequence, and then finishes on some balancy moves to the anchors.
content.location: As of today, this was the 4th route on the wall if you are approaching from the Cactus Cliff area walking west. From Cactus, the path starts on the left (West) from the switchback in the road just past what used to be the main Cactus Cliff parking lot.

content.description: Either start from the ledge, or belay from below and scramble up to the ledge, then follow up the clips and crimps on the right wall of the dihedral finishing on black streaked stone.
content.location:
This is next to

Payment in Pump

on the Cash Wall.

content.description:
This is one stellar crack line! Scramble up solid but hollow rock to the first bolt. Then grab that big flake you think will crush you, and pull onto the route! Clip the second, and carry onward. The route really gets going after bolt 3. Bring those crack skills!

If you're not keen on clipping up a crack, this beauty takes gear perfectly! Run it!
content.protection: 10 bolts including anchors. Gear is optional.
content.location:
It is in between

the 5.6

and

5.10d

and is the only line on that face.

content.description: This is fun stemming up a dihedral. It was bolted to make a 5.6 leader feel comfy.  The most difficult move is between the last bolt and the anchors with a bolt at your waist.
content.location: As of today, this was the 7th route on the wall if you are approaching from the Cactus Cliff area walking west. From Cactus, the path starts on the left (West) from the switchback in the road just past what used to be the main Cactus Cliff parking lot.

content.description: Amandla has a chossy start, but it is fun up top.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is 2 routes left of

Chump Change

.
